txt.en: Instance: Vengeance of the Fallen
'No...not more of them!'
'Worthless... all of you...'
'No! Stay away!'
'So many...so many dead!'
'Can you not see them, [placeholder]?'
'I...I killed you all!'
'Do not struggle, [placeholder]. It shall not avail you.'
'Stay away from me! All of you, stay away!'
'Wake up, maggots!'
'I know much of you, [placeholder], as I did long before you set foot in this land.'
'No!'
'On your feet!'
'The Dark Lord has plans for your pathetic host and this upstart King.'
'Pay attention, you idiots! They're here!'
'I was commanded to let them pass unmolested, and so I did.'
'But when they lie beaten and broken before the Black Gate...'
'My work shall begin anew, and I shall end them here one by one.'
'As for you...'
'You may have slain my servants and freed the condemned -- but now you are mine.'
'Die now, and consider this my truest mercy!'
'What trickery have you wrought?'
'What is this?'
'[placeholder], you shall regret returning to this place.'
'The Bloodletter wants the [placeholder] alive!'
'Answer me, spirit!'
'You have defied my Master again and again, but now...'
'How can I fight a spirit?'
'I shall earn His favour and succeed where so many have failed!'
'You never... scared us before...'
'That [placeholder] and the spirit are back! Go tell the Bloodletter!'
'What has happened, [placeholder]?'
'If we are to prevail, we must clear the hill of Orcs at once!'
'After all this time, you still think yourself a warrior?'
'So be it... you are fated to fail, Faramir!'
'Come, my servants!'
'No, I come to challenge you and all of your Orcs!'
'Submit!'
'This is your end, dog of Númenor!'
'You cannot conceal your true ancestry beneath dark armour or pallid flesh!'
'Look, coward! You stand beneath the hated banner of Gondor!'
'You and all your peoples are foes of the Wainriders!'
'We have waited many long years for our vengeance!'
'Now, we shall have it!'
'Ah, dear Faramir, have you come to watch more die by my hand?'
'Die in shame, dog of Númenor!'
'When I took Ondoher's banner, I meant to scorn him in death.'
'You have done my people a great favour, [placeholder], and so I shall leave you in peace.'
'How fortunate I was that his fool of a son was cursed to witness it all!'
'Heed this kindness, and trouble us no more -- else our peace shall be ended.'
'How many horrors has your folly visited upon the kingdoms of Men, Faramir?'
'Come, men. We ride to Dol Acharn... and to celebration!'
'How many have fallen because of your selfish desire to prove yourself?'
'It is no matter now.'
'Begone, son of Ondoher!'
'Master, help us!'
'Enough of this...'
'Why... why have the Dark Lord's spirits come for me?'
'How have I failed Him?'
